item.title: Dow Jones Opens Higher with 79.79 Point Gain, Reaches 48,783.80 Level
item.description: Top News Dow Jones Opens Higher with 79.79 Point Gain, Reaches 48,783.80 Level 9 hours ago The Dow Jones Industrial Average demonstrated positive momentum at market opening, gaining 79.79 points or 0.16% to reach 48,783.80. This upward movement reflects steady market conditions and measured investor confidence as the trading session began.

item.title: Orchasp Limited Receives In-Principle Approval for ₹8.60 Crore Preferential Allotment
item.description: Orchasp Limited Receives In-Principle Approval for ₹8.60 Crore Preferential Allotment 49 minutes ago Orchasp Limited has received in-principle approval from BSE and NSE for allotment of 2,68,75,000 equity shares worth ₹8,60,00,000 through preferential allotment to promoters for loan conversion. The approvals come with strict compliance requirements including internal control strengthening and specific trading restrictions for allottees. The company must complete listing formalities within twenty days of allotment to avoid penalties.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close 8 hours ago Indian markets closed positively on December 12, with Nifty 50 breaching 26,000 and Sensex surpassing 85,000. The session saw a broad-based rally with 61% of traded stocks advancing. InterGlobe Aviation clarified no SEBI investigation and disclosed a CGST penalty. Infosys witnessed significant promoter share sales.

item.title: Jash Engineering To Buy 90% Stake In WesTech Process Equipment For ₹31.37 Crores
item.description: Jash Engineering To Buy 90% Stake In WesTech Process Equipment For ₹31.37 Crores 1 hour ago Jash Engineering Limited has announced a strategic acquisition of 90% stake in WesTech Process Equipment India Private Limited for ₹31.37 crores. The cash transaction involves purchasing 53,99,849 equity shares and is expected to complete by January 15, 2026. WesTech operates in industrial process equipment with consistent revenue growth from ₹31.28 crores in 2021-22 to ₹56.01 crores in 2024-25.
